rlUL6VJco2MO1npEyhRoTQ.text: It saddens me to give such a low rating to Jamie Oliver's restaurant since I love his TV shows, but the food experience was disappointing...We went there for lunch, no reservation but managed to get a table within 5min.The restaurant itself is nothing special, a bit uncomfortable chairs, but overall OK.Service, again OK... We did ask for our wine for a couple of times since they kept forgetting...And now to the food... The main reason we decided to go.Starters were great... Garlic bread and two types of bruschetta: italian pate and crab meat with avocado. Very good.Mains, on the other hand, were a disaster... I had one of the specials: home made spaghetti with mussels and different fish... The pasta was overcooked and I suspect it was plated for some time since it was just a ball of pasta that did not came apart. I tried to aerate it, but with little success. Then the taste... It was supposed to have all that fish and seafood in a white wine sauce with garlic and chili... But it had salmon, which overpowered everything. All I could taste was pasta with salmon... Which had nothing special. My other friends had the burger (which was very well done... The waiter never asked how he wants it cooked) and his with penne all'arrabbiata... First time that she ever sent a plate back... The pasta was, again, overcooked but it also had a strange aftertaste... We all tried it and came to the same conclusion... To give them credit, they did remove it from the final check, but still, we had much higher expectations from Jamie's restaurant

FEna00gdk8yamKCL_k73sw.text: great meal for our gluten free family.  The waiter was nice and helpful, but service was slow because they were so busy!

hTv2ik7DNpEp2mOEoKA18Q.text: It is debatable if Jamie's Italian is in fact Italian. It may have all the key ingredients, but is the prep and execution the same? Ask most Italians and they will say no. Try authentic Italians like Amici Miei (my fave), and you see a noticeable difference. That said, when you are in town for the theatre, you are limited to where you go before the curtain calls. The food was passable. The garlic prawns to start, were lacking in meat and heavy on the garlic. The crispy squid was okay but a bit stingy in portion size. For the main course, surprisingly where they get it right is the non-Italian Burger. My bae thought it was really tasty. I had the spaghetti with crab which had a lot of shells. Nowt worst than crunchy bits. The service was quick as I have a feeling they are used to this conveyor built service of rotating door tourists and theatre goers. This also showed in the service which was more about getting the deed done, than forming any kind of warm customer service. I would not come here again by choice.

TjZtKum9LH0mrXrjEx96mg.text: We want here before a show. We will not go back. My husband and I both ordered a salad and a pasta dish. The pasta came out and we mentioned where is the salad. The salads came out right behind the pasta. We asked to take the pasta dish back so we could eat the salad since it was the starter. Both dishes would not fit on small table at same time so they took pasta dish back and 2 seconds later another waiter comes out and asked if there was a problem . We said both dishes will not fit on table so could you take back the pasta dish. He then said we would have to toss it out and that is not good. We would have to hold pasta in hand while eating salad. I just said nothing after that he took pasta back and when finished with salad they brought out pasta dishes back. Yes the same pasta dish that was sent out 20 plus minutes earlier. It was cold not good and waiter never came back to ask how dinner was. The food was terrible and boring. Not a lot of flavor. It is  just not the quality you would expect from a Jamie Oliver's restaurant. Jamie needs to check up on food quality and better training of staff. I see other Jamie's restaurants don't score well either. My suggestion so many other good restaurants with better service and food. Just because it says Jamie's doesn't make it good...

QWj8MDjAnpMOIh0Dfe1RQA.text: Mmmm... after having seen many shows on TV on which mr J ravishes about how easy and imporrtant it is to make home-made food, we were a bit disappointed at the thin chips who were just as fine as those at McD. The vegitarian dish was also not up to what we had hope for. Finally the cheek to ask for more tips after the 12,5 % sercive fee added to our bill was a bit too much considering that the waitress should have listened to the nursery rhyme of turning a frown upside down.. Maybe we were just unlucky, or maybe this was as good as this restaurant gets.

J2Oxse5To7QujKbDjishhw.text: The food here at Jamie's Italian was good; the garlic bread I ordered as an appetizer was exemplary, and the steak I ordered as my entrée was fine. However, they filled their carafe with water from a sink labeled "This sink is for hand wash only." This breed of blatant disregard for human health and safety is unacceptable, especially from a restaurant with food of a high enough quality to warrant four stars.

NaTOWzZbk4jBzM3Zs_H_gA.text: mediocre food, mediocre-poor service, London prices. Overrated. Nonna's, a couple of blocks away has much better food and service at better prices.

Nk2ySpvoCzE6W6wFTSJdVA.text: I really enjoyed this place. The service was okay, and the food was quite good. The Italian burger with chips was incredible!

WRv4mGhsjauTT5EodxhzrA.text: Love Jamie Oliver and what he does for kids, but kind of disappointed with the restaurant. Food is average, service is pretty bad for London. We had to ask for our ordered drinks several times, we had 3 waiters changed on us and each one of them was clueless  what our order was. Ordered desert and espresso, they forgot. I just asked for the bill to get out of here. I give 3 stars out of respect to Jaimie , otherwise it would of been 1.

4Bjbfkn-_Kb1saRgT-56dA.text: A delicious go-to. You must try the olives on ice. They are definitely the best olives I've ever had.The boards were all amazing.Pasta was tasty, but nothing I haven't had elsewhere. Lamb and tuna salad were tasty and a little more stand-out. Service was great and a wonderful ambience.Great go-to in the area!

gXJZWNrDrkV4hXPJb9aJpg.text: We walked in at 7p on a Friday night with no booking and were surprisingly seated right away.  Our server was charming and helpful.  Atmosphere was bustling with good energy. A big mix of business men, couples and families.  We started with a pint,  house rose wine,  assorted breads and the fried olives.  Breads were good,  not fantastic.  But the olives. ..oh my the olives!  They were fantastic!  Perfectly fried shell,  meaty green olive,  then a spicy sausage center.  All smothered in a fresh tomato sauce with fried garlic and basil crisps. I'd go back just for those! For our mains, I had the THREE-CHEESE CARAMELLE which was delicious.  For being a cheesy pasta dish,  it was surprisingly light.  Very fresh rose sauce.  My husband had the PENNE CARBONARA in which he was very happy with.  Very creamy and decadent.  Overall,  we were really satisfied.  I think is well priced . We'll be back!

CY9IUkJvnrfT7Fa8GQE_aQ.text: I came here with a group of ten people, which is incredible since I was pretty sure there weren't nine other people in the world who would elect to spend a couple of hours with me. But, I was paying, so that was probably most of the reason why.This place looks like it used to be a pub. Because it used to be a pub. They dressed it up a bit but didn't change it to the point where you can't tell.You can tell. And that's okay.Everything that everyone ordered looked like something I'd have wanted to eat. That doesn't usually happen. In particular, the canneloni looked legit. I had the chicken breast. It was very good...but that's a super boring choice. My fault there. But, it was one of the only meals that I knew was gluten free. So, not my fault. And shame on you for just judging me there.The price wasn't bad. The location is convenient, albeit near touristy. A few people at the table said they'd come back. They probably don't use Yelp though, so you're never going to hear it from them on here. Hence...me. Telling you.You're welcome.PS the bathroom is five hundred miles away. It's so far that I felt like I had to tell everybody so they didn't think I left partway through dinner to do anything other than pee. Hate it when the bathroom is so far away it stirs up the imagination of your fellow co-diners. That's imagination wasted. I'd rather they used it for something else. Like coming up with a more creative name for this restaurant.Guy's Name + Type of Cuisine + LocationNice.

EhbGoeMWB-JNI177o2H0KQ.text: Being a tourist in London for the first time, we had no idea where to grab a decent dinner.  After a hectic day sightseeing around, we ended up at the busy picadilly circus/soho area.  We were so hungry and didnt know what to eat and we saw Jamie's italian which seems like a large restaurant and looks pretty nice...  We were hesitant to go in at first since this is owned by a famous celebrity chef (jamie oliver) in a touristy part of the city (guy fieri kitchen at NY timesquare was a total tourist trap), i consider myself a foodie and absolutely dispise tourist trap restaurant, but we were so hungry and with no reservation to anywhere else... Eh what the heck... My experience here ended up being a total surprise!! The food was absolutely delicious!!! The interior is very roomy with 3 floors!! We ordered the squid ink pasta and the mushroom fettucini, the pasta was homemade and jamie oliver's use of different spices in his dish added depth to a simple pasta dish.  Who would have thought a celebrity chef chain restaurant could be this delicious! I wish he opens one in NY!!!Overall if you are a tourist like me and not too familiar with the city and dont know what to eat on your first or second day in the city, jamie's italian is a very good choice! Unless you want to end up at Pret or Mcdonalds..

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

oG61lWYWtYpaEv5IuN0j0w.text: First time in London and was looking forward to try Jamie's italian. It met all my expectations. The food was delicious! Ordered the famous plank for two, the taglietti bolognese and the brownie desert with salted caramel. Our server was friendly and attentive, even wiped the cutlery before providing it to us (not sure if this is common here). Would definitely come back if am ever back in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Molten chocolate lava cake with salted caramel ice cream and pralines.

UILIkkUGN8m1D_3xgOQKbg.text: Stay away. Went for a family dinner mainly because my sister wanted to "see Jamie Oliver"... Oh the optimism of a 16 yrs. Service is slow and weird- apologizing for restaurant mishaps but not putting in any effort to make our stay better (what kind of restaurant doesn't have toothpicks?). Took the vegetable plank after we were told it was massive and discovered it was 3 small plates with veggies soaked in olive oil that left a horrible after taste. When ordering entrees we discovered all Italian "classics" were missing today: no soups, no boulogne, no lasania, no ceaser salad, no salmon fillet. Ended up ordering the burger (sides are extra) and super food salad which were good and carbonara pasta that was flavorless. All and all it was just disappointing - they do have WiFi though.

H9uOcxVJu7mHci_0g_IL0Q.text: Felt like a total tourist going to a Jamie Oliver restaurant but had to try it.  Food was good but not great. Started with some pork crackling, which was tasty but the dipping sauce quite bland. Then had a duck leg, which was quite good. Had a caprese salad, which had a good amount of mozzarella but the tomatoes were not particularly ripe. Overall, a nice meal but not great.

Y_5wIVCaQbz2oWC4b0Aetw.text: For the record, I'm a HUGE Jamie Oliver fan. Not exaggerating: I have ALL his cookbooks at home and he rarely steers me wrong... at home. But at Jamie's Italian in Soho the fare is mediocre. I mean, I know it's a family friendly restaurant in a very touristy part of town but, frankly, the food was cafeteria quality. Two stars is being generous. So sad. So very sad.

GooemfvZL7nqEBBQIfC1Dw.text: This is not the quality I expect from Jamie Oliver, certainly not very healthy. I had the marinated flash steak with butter, slaw and chips. The chips were done to perfection, though the portion was small. The slaw was one of the worst I've ever had. What looked like good purple cabbage badly prepared was rough to eat, with no recognisable dressing. Flavourless and nearly inedible. The steak was positively swimming in butter, with a big herbed glob on top. I had to scrape it to side and dab each morsel on a clean part of the plate. It was so heavily dressed the flavour of the meat was lost in it. Not worth the money, and sorely disappointing. The rather grumpy waiter only came alive when I tipped him 20%. I would have appreciated a friendlier attitude before and during the meal, not after. He appeared to assume I was a tourist because of my accent, which I am not. Unfortunate no matter how you look at it.

SPpvY93aD-D08imnm7RIcQ.text: We recently visited London and we stopped in for the lunch special... I believe it was two courses for 12 pound. I had the black truffle pappardelle and a grilled chicken sandwich. Both were amazing. That truffle pasta was to die for though... My husband had fried squid and pasta bolognese. He said they were awesome too. Everything tasted fresh and homemade. The prices were very reasonable for a "celebrity" chef restaurant. I live in Las Vegas and I doubt I could find anything comparable for under $20 here. I really wish Jamie would open a restaurant here! I can't wait to go back to London and try more of his food.

qRRMJ7IF0RcxPyAne6lRwA.text: Overall the experience was 'meh' and it did start off a little irritating. I booked a table online for lunch at 12pm and noted that the website (and the online booking system) claimed that it opens at 11am. I turned up at 11.50am and was met by a blank stare telling me that they didn't open until 12pm and so I couldn't sit down until then. I'm really not sure why, as the tables seemed to be there, ready and available, but I was made to wait in the bar area until 12.03pm. Not the most customer-friendly start! So we were shown to our table for two - I suppose there is always the trade off between giving customers enough personal space and making a profit for the restaurant by getting more tables in. It felt that the profit won that battle hands down. The service was somewhat brisk and cold, but it was efficient. I ordered the Caprese salad (large portion) and my friend ordered the prawn linguine (small portion) with a side salad. I got a bowl of mozzarella and tomato with some ham and olive oil - exactly what was advertised. The only thing is that the tomatoes didn't really taste of anything, there was a smidge too much oil and the dish was about ten quid, so it didn't feel like I had really got my money's worth. My friend's pasta was fine, the coffee we had afterwards was ok, (they only serve full fat milk which ruined it a bit), but at 22 quid a head, it felt like it was on the steep side for the experience, which frankly wasn't as warm, inviting or tasty as pizza express! If you are in the area and need lunch, try Brasserie Zedel instead.

0VSTnxI7y_Yz96Czy4O0pg.text: Went with a friend for a very late dinner on Saturday night and managed to get a table without a reservation. That said, it was the last one so it's probably best to book ahead. The food was good, but not mind blowingly so (because of the time, they had run out of the specials so had the 'famous shrimp pasta' and the lamb stew). Service was great, and it had a nice atmosphere. While in the whole it was a really nice time, I left slightly underwhelmed with the food.

X-BMYFhZReagYGp7VU_tBA.text: I was invited here for a romantic dinner with a Jamie-fan. We dressed up for the occasion but obviously Jamie's Italian is quite casual and this branch in particular seems to be a former pub so it's down-to-earth, with lots of dark wood. The friendly waiter asked if we wanted any starters and brought us two choices without waiting for us to choose. On the one side, that was quite charming and refreshing but on the other hand it could have gone wrong too. He brought us green olives on ice and fried ravioli with a tomato dip. Both starters were creative and delicious. Our mains, pasta dishes, were good aswell but didn't pop my cherry. For dessert I think we shared a Sicilian Lemon Cheesecake which we didn't even finish and that's why my review is just A-OK. I would have wished that all courses had withheld exciting surprises like the starters did.

w_DHnA5hspi3Wxh0iidP5Q.text: Gluten free pasta was pretty good.  Got the Garlic Shrimp.House Merlot was fab!  To busy for a relaxing meal.

-8Rk7PwOX8ZMU33eWKoLqA.text: This place was okay, not too bad, however not as good as the first time I went.  The atmosphere is great, and the restaurant filled with people.  However, the appetizers we ordered to share were not very good, they were not good to share with groups, only good for one or two people.  The main entree I had was very good, I had a red meat pasta that was delicious, however my friend who ordered the house special risotto complained that it was too salty and lacked flavor.  However, we did order a great lemon meringue cheesecake at the finale of our meal that was quite tasty.  This place is okay, not as good as some other Italian places I have been too, but if you want a decent meal at this famous chain, it is not bad.Nothing mind blowing, but average, with a pleasant location in the heart of Soho.

yF9rayoRKhOzZS-o66c9Ug.text: *****VEGETARIAN*****I have long theorised that some chefs excel (only) at cooking certain ingredients, not dishes. I am slowly coming to the conclusion that Jamie Oliver is one of these, at least judging him by his restaurants. The good new is that he seems to excel at all mushroom dishes. I have never had a bad mushroom dish here, and his use of porcini mushrooms and truffles is well thought and nuanced. However, most other veggie dishes seem bland and standard in comparison.The desserts are worth a shout tho!Prob the best thing about this particular spot is the bar - its a great spot for soho and very stylishly designed.

EPwOXoV98RcIb0S7fw0iwg.text: My friend had her birthday dinner here the other night, for a group of 14. This is a chain all over London, but it was my first time, and it reminded me of those chain Italian restaurants we have back in America- like Olive Garden or Cheesecake Factory. She ordered some starters for the table- surprising that you have to pay for bread at an Italian restaurant! We also had some bruschetta and meats and cheese, which were nothing spectacular, really. But the oddest thing was my pasta, which was the Vongole Tagliolini. It was spicy with an overdose of pepper, which is a very weird taste for a pasta dish. I also ordered a small dish but they gave me the large instead. One thing to note: the house red wine, Jamie's Rosso, is quite decent. Overall I'd say this place is good for groups, but when you have so many other and better options in Soho, there's not much else reason to come back.

4czTxv58r0A5rrL0z3vfdw.text: Considering about the price, and how famous Jamie Oliver is in UK, I have to say I'm a little disappointed to the food there.We waited for more than 30 minutes for every dish.The portion for the sharing plank is way too much for we two, and I don't understand why we couldn't order that for one person so that we don't need to waste.The lamb chop was simply bad, very blend.I couldn't taste any umami, or the original taste of lamb at all. They were very hard to chew, and the portion was extremely big as well.The liver main course was okay, with very heavy smelling and tasted very raw, ppl love liver would probably like it.It took so much time to waiting for the main, and we don't have to try desserts at all.Will not go there next time:S

dLJrC3roygb1NTkviQ64mQ.text: I think, for the name and the price and the location, it was just passable.A colleague and I went there for lunch. We had the vegetable plank for two as a starter and the mushroom risotto as a main. I thoroughly enjoyed the starter. The various vegetables, cheeses, etc. were all really tasty.Frankly mushroom risotto is a pretty predictable offering for vegetarians, so no points for thinking that up. The risotto itself was a bit gritty and not the texture I expected. It had some nice mushrooms, but not an overwhelming number.To be fair, we ordered coffee after lunch and the coffee was really fabulous. Something to write home about. I think the problem with names like "Jamie Oliver" and in particular, this place where they're throwing around terms like "flagship" restaurant, it sets your expectations pretty high. Three stars under these circumstances would probably be 4 stars elsewhere. But what I got here was just three stars given the expectations.Given the price we paid (£70 for lunch when all was said and done), I'm going to look elsewhere before I come back here.

4oPXs4PFSFjxgh4TvcZwCg.text: I bit disappointed. The pasta was lovely, but the mains are not great... Mains are well made but are very disappointing.One of us  had lamp, which was nice, but was very uncomfortable to eat as it was served on a narrow chopping board.  Chicken on a piece of bread with mushroom sous was ok, nothing grand, chicken was a bit burned though. Turkey was just a flat Turkey Kiev kinda thing with a bit of cheese inside and an egg on top, oh and a tiny bit of truffle.  Like I said, PASTA was GREAT. Mains are sad. For desert I ordered 2 sorbet (mango and lemon) and 1 caramel ice cream scoops, which were nice, but not the greatest for Italian cuisine.Atmosphere was very nice but our table was next to a wardrobe with cutlery and the till so the staff were making LOTS of noise and kept bumping my chair which was quite annoying. When we asked to be moved we were told that everything is booked although there were plenty of tables available.

yk7OOh4mdDGEnJFJoYqzpA.text: Amazing Italian food with fresh ingredients! Though, I would not expect anything less from Jamie Oliver. The restaurant is located in the heart of Piccadilly Circus. The attire is definitely casual, so fear not if you want to just pop in for a bite. The garlic bread was a work of art with its presentation (on top of being delicious!). The spicy arrabbiata was excellent, but not for the faint of heart when it comes to spice. There were thinly sliced habaneros on top, so be sure you really like hot foods before ordering. The tagliatelle bolognese had a deep, richly flavored meat sauce. You could tell this sauce had been simmered for hours. Also, the pricing was reasonable considering the location. Great experience, awesome food!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Garlic bread- a work of art!
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Look at the inside of that garlic bread!
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Tagliatelle bolognese

FBIRrNu9KKQAXcSfwWanJw.text: The food is fantastic but the service is slow A.F. that's American-speak for slow as F.  Time is worth more than good food or money for that matter. You just wasted it Jamie.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Steak and frites
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Bolognase
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Fritto misto pretty good

_LtOhtBw9WwbHFABR5h5sQ.text: The worst be ever been to. The bartender is not busy but really rude with customers. The drinks were ok, not impressive.and did not match the menu price.When the waiter walk by, he slipped and said 'fuck' to my face. Really rude bar.

YipVbZxTslbfzJUK0AvTrA.text: Poor service, the beer was hot and arrived 15 min after ordered, never stayed to find out if the food worthy...

B10ekC1cYywORNRI6FUGIw.text: Really. Really. Poor Italian food. Lacks flavor and complexity. Just - don't even try it to find out for yourself.

3JiIkUzSdRyIgQvuKbEHwg.text: Meh. 2.25 stars...We ended up here because all the other restaurants in the area were packed. The night we came in the fryers were down so it eliminated a few things from the menu we wanted to order. The pasta was decent but nothing to write home about. The crab toast was ok but again not amazing. All in all it was sort of a forgettable meal. We probably wouldn't go back. The waitress was the high point of the evening (friendly).

zONnHoVaATwRYNB_wgVfpw.text: Jamie's Italian in Soho was the WORST service I've had in YEARS. First, the host as said the wait would only be half an hour. We ended up waiting an hour and fifteen minutes before we were seated. During that whole time the hostess never attempted to contact us, apologize, or reassure us about the wait time. After finally being seated, we waited for a period of time as waiters ignored us and avoided making eye contact. Finally after waving wildly, our waiter named Bruno came over. We were concerned when he didn't take any notes for an order of 5 people (including appetizers, drinks, mains, and even allergy information). Of course, he made several errors. I ordered a glass of red wine. He gave me a glass of white. He also completely forgot my appetizer. Not once did he come check if we were satisfied with our meal. It was unbelievable. He also brought another person in our group's meal after the rest of the table had finished. He never apologized. Most of the time we could see the waiter hanging out with his friends or flirting with another waitress. The food was mediocre. The purpose of my review was to admonish the service. Don't make the mistake of stumbling in hungry to Jamie's Italian.

s-clQvVvPY0QGWRhLfC5zg.text: Came here with my cousin as he was in town. We went on a Wednesday night in mid August and I had booked a table for 2 at 7pm on Open Table.I was really shocked by how busy it was! The waitering staff had only been able to prepare our table 15 minutes late, which didn't bother me as it's completely out of their control. What was great was that the host was very friendly and communicated with me and acknowledged that they were running late. He had a sense of urgency but was very friendly. Thumbs up to you sir!For our starter, we had the meat platter on the plank. It was okay, but difficult to eat on such a small table. They had brought out 2 cans to rest the plank, but this made things difficult to serve yourself. It was a small table, and it needed to fit both of our plates, silverware, the meat plank, garlic bread, my cousin's mojito, 2 water glasses and a bottle of sparkling water! If you can imagine, it was like trying to play jenga with your food!Garlic bread was okay. Warm toasted white bread slathered in butter always tastes great, you know...For my main, I had the squid and mussels pasta. Which was really tasty. I've never had squid ink pasta, but it was wonderful. Al dente and super tasty. I would totally look into ordering this again, or making it myself: jamieoliver.com/videos/l…The only downside is that I didn't have a bowl or anything to put my mussel shells in. Which made me quite embarrassed to put them directly on the table. However, there wasn't any room on this tiny table for a shell bowl!All in all, if you are looking for a relatively low-moderate priced place, with great service, above average food that would be difficult to make for yourself at home with small tables, this is a place for you. I would probably come back again if I was looking for something a bit more upscale than a Pizza Express, but not as flashy as Bocca Di Lupo.

G5NdY5UsOpI31nzmbb0LKg.text: You know when you go to a place where the food is OK, the environment is quite cozy, and the service is not bad, and you end up feeling full and content, but nothing more (or less)? Well, THATS the feeling I took with me after a dinner with co-workers at Jamies Italian. 'OK'. Actually, when I think of it, the only time i would RECOMEND this place is for a gathering with co-workers or such... If you have a date or a girls/boys night out, there are plenty other places you can navigate towards..

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

67X-phVbldZqJEILT8vHYA.text: Excellent Angus Filet and fresh garden salad for your pallet. Service was average but functional. Would god again for the cheese fries and fresh mango sorbet.

pNbHS8jo-AxtrMDM8dGx_w.text: It made me laugh that we went to an Italian restaurant in London since we live in Italy, but we were with friends from the states and that's what sounded good to them. I thought the atmosphere was nice and the food was good. I got a quinoa salad with chicken and it was tasty for sure. So, I skipped on the Italian part, but found the salad to be exactly what I was looking for. The rest or our group seemed to enjoy their dining experience.

bEd_7PGzSOgbi2r0MMn8AA.text: Awful restaurant especially considering it is supposed to have a noteworthy "chef" behind it.  In all honesty, I've had meals at the Olive Garden that tasted fresher and better than this.  It's a tourist trap that lures you in with a recognized chef, but don't fall for it.  We sat up on the third floor by one of the kitchen areas, and they had a microwave on the counter about 2 feet from where I was seated.  The thing was running nonstop heating up meals...I had the Tagliatelle which was bland and dry, and then The most disappointing Steak Frites I've ever had.  Don't be a sucker - this place sucks.

M3jaBcQ1Hs0X3AplepB08w.text: Went there in spite of the mediocre reviews since he's one of our favorite TV chef personalities.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed in the overall experience.  The service was very slow (we had to wave down our server a couple of times).  Additionally, two of the items we attempted to order were not available.  She didn't list which ones weren't available, and we had to guess.The food was okay (maybe expectations were too high), but nothing special.  I had the cabonara (spelling?) and while it was okay, he should have gone with something a bit more than basic bacon.Neat to see, but nothing I'd go back for.

KUg9xOlm3gV9LqHpbViPFQ.text: This place was recommended by our taxi driver on our way to Piccadilly Circus, I know it only has 3 stars but I must say that we were impressed  after an 1/2 hour waiting we were seated in the 3rd level nice airy floor ..the food was served promptly and it tasted oh soo good ;)Nice experience and good prices for London

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

nub-o37_Zjq0G5wxsoGdJQ.text: Came in for a beer and some pub food, it's alright but it can be better. The service is ok but nothing special I've been there a few times and they had their friers broken every time. The hand crafted is good though definitely try the Liberta, and other crafted beers. Since the frier wasn't working I got the stuffed chilli peppers they were expensive and only got 3 pieces, it was really tasty but too expensive for what you get. In conclusion just an average place nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Bar menu
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Stuffed mini chilli peppers

LMkrzAstzkgqR4W3KkkTkA.text: This place is a tourist trap. I was served by a very pushy waiter who insisted I should take the fish special. It was full of thorns and very "fishy". The waiter said I shouldn't have the veggie ragú because it wasn't good and instead suggested a gluten free tomato pasta which was disgusting, the sauce was sweet and the pasta terribly cooked. I hated every minute. The place is old looking, you feel like you're in a cheap pub. If you're looking for a good healthy alternative just go across the street to the Whole Foods. Although overcrowded, food is much better there.

9WeBSAsEXwGIqFmKIIx-Ww.text: Me and my husband ate here on our trip to London about a month ago. The atmosphere of the restaurant was great but the dinner and customer service was lackluster for the price.

NXTl2vHcSUeA_Q9JaabyKw.text: I don't like Italian food and was scared to go there (that was before they told me it was not a random Jamie but Jamie Oliver). Nice restaurant and Terrasse, basically it's an old reconverted pub. The service was great and the food too! I like the trendy/smart casual style of the dishes and the great service. We went for starters and main but couldn't go for a dessert (we were so full). I will definitively go back to Jamie's Italian!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. And softshell crabs for the main with avocado
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Starters with grated port, chestnut mushrooms with melted mozzarella and calamari for my friend
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

7oRo2XkYTh6KeT7GZxKNIw.text: Stopped for lunch today.  We have previously been to another location of Jamie's Italian and had a very good experience.  That may have been because we were with a member of staff from another of Jamie's properties or it could just be how it is!We started with the daily special bruschetta which is just the right size for two people, or someone whom would rather just take it all for themselves!  The taste was good with a large amount if the buffalo ricotta cheese on top.For the main course I chose the Wild Rabbit pasta.  Rabbit is not always easy to find in the US so this is truly a treat.  The dish (pasta/rabbit) were well prepared and very nicely spiced.  Portion size was perfect!  Chose to not have dessert today as we are planning for something later.  Overall this is a place we will always visit when we come back to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Wild Rabbit
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Artisan bread bruschetta - 10 July lunch special

pmJEFvHpuWUlaCfV3saCew.text: Totally happy with this place.We were a party of six Americans in town for a little business and a little fun. We visited at midday on the Sunday before the May Bank Holiday. I checked the online reservations and there was nothing available for a party of our size for another 90 minutes, so I was thrilled when we turned up with no reservation and were seated right away. I should say I directed our group to this location instead of the one at Covent Garden because I suspected this might happen. Glad I was right!We started with the arancini margherita, Italian nachos, and something else that apparently wasn't worth remembering (I went back and checked the menu; it was bread). We ended up ordering a second arancini because they turned out to be so delicious.I stuck with the simple penne pomodoro for my main. It was exactly the kind of comfort food I was craving. The breadcrumbs added a nice texture.The vegetarian in our party had the gnudi and loved it. It was quite rich; the smaller portion size was plenty.My husband went with the crab spaghettini and deemed it "too fishy." Maybe it was the anchovies?A couple of burgers and a steak rounded out our group's selections. They cleaned their plates, but they also didn't write letters home about them. Perhaps they should have stuck with pasta.We put dessert in our waiter's hands, and he returned with an enormous wooden plank bearing four desserts: the epic brownie (demolished), tiramisu (even my tiramisu-hating husband had to admit it was good), macerated strawberries (a surprising favorite!), and the raspberry pavlova (the only one with anything left on the platter). I still can't get over how delicious those strawberries were.The service was good, the food was hot and fresh, and the atmosphere was pleasant. All in all, it was a great choice for lunch on a beautiful day, and it helped me keep American tourists out of McDonalds. Win-win!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Desserts
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Jamie's Italian Burger
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Arancini Margherita

Wyq20_OgzcYhNSdv1H89Kw.text: One night while exploring London we ended up walking around SoHo to take pictures and find a nice place for dinner. We looked at a few menu's and thought that the Italian place would be great.There is a theater right across the street and we were able to get tickets for the next show. That escalated the urgency of making a choice for dinner since now that there was a clock running against us and we have approximately one hour for dinner. We dashed into Jamie's and were immediately pleased with how quickly we were seated and served drinks. The food was also fairly quick, was steaming hot and looked and smelled great. I had the seafood pasta and Isabel had the pasta with meatballs. All conversation stopped when we each took our first bite. After a full day of touring around London we were tired and hungry, and my delicious seafood pasta had my full attention. This was one of the great meals that we enjoyed while visiting.Quantity and quality of the meals was excellent. The staff was attentive and quick. The SoHo location is perfect if you have business in the area or are just exploring like us. We absolutely recommend Jamie's if you have the opportunity to enjoy a meal there.

vGBwiZIQ24_fiHEdKkMldg.text: Allowed our concierge to suggest this for my group of five. We had two kids and a vegetarian...Italian always works but this place was not good. We had five meals and three small starters...starters we fun and tasty. The alcohol was good and service was okay. The main dishes were beyond disappointing. The meatballs were ground beef with no seasoning...maybe other meats in there but a disturbing flavor. The pasta in both meals were under done at best. It was overall a low point for the evening. I understand that celebrity chefs are just that...celebrity and selling name. We will not be back.

IutSDPeUIovO7xWeTxCicQ.text: Quick lunch. Reasonable prices for a fixed menu (2 courses). Carbonara is mediocre but the fritto misto (fish and calamari) was amazing! Service is also great and if you're looking for a quick lunch, this is a great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

5lDJnUaPKSNrNk3H5cF3xQ.text: My husband and I have a very good experience here. Great location to sit outside -- set back off the sidewalk and along a pedestrian walkway (no traffic to deal with). Inside was very, very nice too. We had to go inside to order at the bar, but they delivered the food. Everyone spoke Italian as their first language and tried their best to find someone to help us answer our questions and accommodate us. Very friendly and cooperative. The food was very good; the meat tray appetizer especially. Caesar salad and carbonara was good too.

ACSKURWOB1NPS0JIGpJznw.text: Unfortunately I just got diarrhea after dining at Jamie's. Luckily it was not explosive diarrhea. Besides the diarrhea we had to experience this awkward moment between the host and waiter when they were disputing about where to seat us. I ordered the two course meal. I chose the Fritto Misto for the starter and the Italian Steak and Fries for the main course. The Fritto Misto which consists of light battered fish and squid was very salty. For the main dish the steak was overcooked. The seasoning was well but the meat was not tender at all. I've been to Jamie's in Reading before and had a much better experience. The food at that location was excellent. It's unfortunate that the quality is not consistent in every location.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Italian Steak and Fries
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Fritto Misto

UMPHEC5FNTAmn1WA1xGBhA.text: The steak was good, nothing to get excited about, but a decent meal. The service was very good. I had tiramisu and it was too bitter and too much alcohol. It lacked the necessary balance. Similarly, the cocktails also lacked balance. I'm thinking Piccadilly location results in sped and not care in execution.

7xQiH8Br2s4E6bAqlSQyqg.text: This place was a major disappointment in terms of service and food. I was really disappointed because I've wanted to try something of Jamie's for awhile and with a termed stay in London and lots of food I was dying to try, this was a wasted opportunity for something much better in my stomach (and wallet). Don't bother coming here. This is for the restaurant portion, I can't speak for the bar downstairs, which was PACKED.2 stars for being clean and good location/rooftop atmosphere and decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Overly sweet drinks
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Very mediocre food

N4ZCBcrykQMTFPMGDBXgUA.text: Despite being in a tourist-heavy area, this spot is well-priced with good quality! Popped in for more of a happy hour experience, mixing and matching from their lunch menu and apps. Solid charcuterie and pasta dishes, with fresh ingredients in a homey casual setting. Definitely get dessert, specifically Jamie's Strawberry Polenta cake. Patio seating available, good people-watching spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Exterior
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Downstairs art
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

jFGKq1aL_g9Yv-ADEcegQA.text: After a long day of walking and touristing, sometimes a good old fashion, homey meal is what the body needs.  I came to this realization with a sensible craving of Italian food.  Maybe the craving spawned from seeing this resto close to my hotel or at the many locations across london.  However, all in all, I wanted some Italian food.  I was pretty hungry, so I started with a pint and the Creamy Burrata as my appetizer.   The creaminess was perfect and the amount of tomatoes, pesto and herbs matched the amount of cheese.  Someone did their math homework on proper proportions.  For my entree, I enjoyed a Lobster Mezzaluna.  What's a mezzaluna you say?  I don't know.  But it had lobster, other shellfish and the pasta made with squid ink.  It was a magnificent dish.  Each bite had a various savory flavors and the amount was perfect.  Maybe too perfect because I didn't have room for dessert.  Maybe next time.

Nv-HGIj592ddJYyX88anQQ.text: Perroni, some other 3 local beers and stop counting. Place is cool. Sit down outside to watch people walking all the times. I was excited rk enter because it offers a terrace view with bar but it was reserved so it will be next time when I come back

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

u2dcFVKJpnLAno5_1gjcJg.text: Came in because Jamie Oliver is my idol for years. Ordered half size spicy sausage pasta and fresh squeezed orange juice. The service is a little bit... clumsy? Not sure if the restaurant is more causal like this or it's just me feeling not too professional regarding the service. The food tastes ok. Not too impressed... the sauce was a bit watery (not in terms of flavor but more like consistency). I prefer a bit thicker consistency so it feels like the sauce hugs the pasta with its flavor better. Overall Its good to try but I probably won't come back. I would still try other Jamie's restaurant if I happen to be near one though.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

jE1H0iYWnFDkgXWhG54raQ.text: This restaurant and experience gets a generous 4/5 total and except for the food it can be accredited to the cozy location and decor.The service was nothing out of the aordinary.We ordered a- Penne Carbonara, that although tasted well was not impressive in regards of quantity.It got a 7/10.- Caesar Sallad. Good flavor on the chicken not very lean. Homemade croutons.Sauce lacked a distinctive and rich taste, and the absence of parmesan made the meal overall not that flavor-filled.6/10- Garlic Bread. Awesome. Crispy and soft. Flavor very present. 10/10- Brownie with caramelized popcorn. A bit crumbly. Rich chocolate flavor that mixed very well with its ice cream and pop corn. 9/10- Vanilla Cheesecake, very average in both consistency and flavor. Cheese-part tasted and felt like vanilla yoghurt, and the crust was quite stiff. 6/10

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Brownie, CheeseCake
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom. Penne Carbona, Caesars Sallad

pKc1WoxnuYt1AGC7ISsBog.text: Are here a few weeks ago, and the service , the food, drinks and atmosphere were all terrific. Great location in the heart of Piccadilly Circus London. Easy to reach by tube. I will recommend and visit again

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

kAWb5yxA_YbUqgC_5dv3iQ.text: Bad service. Waited for a long time and got poor tasted food. Not recommend. Jamie Oliver is my idol but his restaurant made me disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Jamie's Italian - Piccadilly - London, United Kingdom

PNYv0GHS_P0fcFDtkVBXcQ.text: Food is bland. Gnocchi has no taste, garlic flat bread isn't garlicy.Wouldn't come back. I don't even know what else we ordered because we didn't even eat it.

jqD_ns97EnJnY1gAFMBypw.text: Great Vibe and service. Seated on rooftop part of restaurant, much more relaxed than indoor area.

JY4u7mzS8yPV5r-QCil6eQ.text: My family decided to try this spot out while visiting the area and we were not disappointed! The drinks were really good and the pasta even better.

F4ybscQujl06bPai8qZvAw.text: This branch of Jamie's Italian is massive, replacing a former corner pub and the shop next door.  It still has a pub-ish feel inside (translate as dark and a bit dingy) with another massive dining room downstairs.We were drawn in by the tables outside though, trying to make the most of a rare balmy Summer evening in London.  Very lucky to spot an empty table we just went for it as there were no staff in sight.  The people next to us had their three course meal all delivered at once, and their puddings were spilling over onto our table - they were very stressed and gave up half way through each portion.The only staff coming outside were those collecting empties, promises to send someone to take our order turned out to be empty ...  inside we were informed that there is no service outdoors and we'd have to order at the bar.Unsurprisingly, none of this made us feel particularly welcome while the folk across the street at Zedel seemed to have all the fun ...  guess what, we crossed over and had an amazing experience with the Frenchies.

hxVnoprzQtYEWwS0lxCCZQ.text: I was so excited to finally go to one of Jamie Oliver's restaurant, but after sending back under cooked risotto only to receive another under cooked plate, it was clear the kitchen was not concerned with putting love and care into the food, which is very surprising under the Jamie Oliver name. I was quite disappointed.

sooiQey_cDRfwX2YtfhVSw.text: We came here on a recommendation and the disappointments kept communications coming.First,  you cannot order anything off the menu.  While I would agree this is normal from most tourist traps,  any Italian restaurant can whip up a side sauce of something that is already on the menu.  I guess the waiter couldn't figure out how to profit from it.The server bringing the meal did not know who ordered what do we had to run it like a role call.  The food took forever and we sat down at 5:45.The pork dish was hideous.Stay away!
